results.title: England's wealth from wool
results.creator_credit: Basic Films and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: Illustrates the extent of sheep farming in Britain in the early Middle Ages, from the beginning of the export trade in wool through to the Industrial Revolution and the gradual introduction of machine methods into the wool industry.

results.title: England's Shakespeare
results.brief_description: A study of Stratford-on-Avon, the birthplace of William Shakespeare, the greatest English dramatist. This town is now the site of the Shakespeare Memorial Theatre, a place of interest to students and tourists from all over the world.
results.description: A study of Stratford-on-Avon, the birthplace of William Shakespeare, the greatest English dramatist. This town is now the site of the Shakespeare Memorial Theatre, a place of interest to students and tourists from all over the world.

results.title: England's Henry Moore
results.brief_description: A look at the life and works of one of England’s most prolific and famous sculptors, Henry Moore who became well known for his ‘reclining women’. The film uses old footage and includes interviews with Helmut Schmidt, Sir Stephen Spender, Lord Callaghan and Jill Craigie.
results.description: A look at the life and works of one of England’s most prolific and famous sculptors, Henry Moore who became well known for his ‘reclining women’. The film uses old footage and includes interviews with Helmut Schmidt, Sir Stephen Spender, Lord Callaghan and Jill Craigie.

results.title: Enginemen
results.creator_credit: BFI, Unit Five Seven and Michael Grigsby
results.brief_description: An outstanding documentary offering an impression of engine at locomotive sheds on the outskirts of Manchester, filmed during the early hours of a wintry morning. There is very little commentary other than the men themselves commenting on the changes being brought about in their lives by extensive dieselisation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BFI, Unit Five Seven and Michael Grigsby
results.description: An outstanding documentary offering an impression of engine at locomotive sheds on the outskirts of Manchester, filmed during the early hours of a wintry morning. results.title: Engineering: flue gas analysis (Orsat apparatus)
results.creator_credit: Audio Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: Setting up the Orsat gas analyzer; drawing in an air-free sample of flue gas; absorbing and measuring the amounts of carbon dioxide, oxygen and carbon monoxide in the sample; and how to calculate the amount of nitrogen.

results.title: Engineering electronics. No. 3. The Triode: amplification
results.brief_description: This film reviews the diode principle; compares the diode and the triode; explains the triode amplifier circuit, amplification of DC voltage changes, amplification of AC voltages, distortion, and amplification of audio-frequency signals.
results.description: This film reviews the diode principle; compares the diode and the triode; explains the triode amplifier circuit, amplification of DC voltage changes, amplification of AC voltages, distortion, and amplification of audio-frequency signals.

results.title: Engine bearing manufacture
results.creator_credit: Cine Service and Repco Engine Parts Group Technical Film
results.brief_description: The processes involved in the manufacture of bearings and bushes for all types of automobiles are explained. The works are in Tasmania and 600 different types of bearing sets are produced. The trade is not only within Australia, orders are received from the East. Africa, USA and Germany.
